{{small|(Dave Moralez and Jack Storm)}} |reign = 1 |date = {{dts|2006|02|18}} |days = {{age in days nts|month1=02|day1=18|year1=2006|month2=09|day2=24|year2=2006}} |location = [[Orpington]], [[Kent]], [[England]] |event = IPW:UK A Taste of IPW 2006 |notes = https://www.ipwuk.com/results/ipwuk-a-taste-of-ipw-2006 |ref = }}{{PWtitlereign |number = 3 |champion = Dragon Hearts
{{small|(Dragon Phoenix and [[Rockstar Spud|Spud]])}} |reign = 1 |date = {{dts|2006|09|24}} |days = {{age in days nts|month1=09|day1=24|year1=2006|month2=12|day2=10|year2=2006}} |location = [[Orpington]], [[Kent]], [[England]] |event = IPW:UK 2nd Anniversary Weekend: Night Two |notes = This was a [[Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match]].https://www.cagematch.net//?id=1&nr=8266 |ref = }}{{PWtitlereign |number = 4 |champion = [[$wiss Money Holding]]
{{small|([[Ares (wrestler)|Ares]] and [[Claudio Castagnoli]])}} |reign = 1 |date = {{dts|2006|12|10}} |days = {{age in days nts|month1=12|day1=10|year1=2006|month2=09|day2=23|year2=2007}} |location = [[Colchester]], [[Essex]], [[England]] |event = IPW:UK The Dome Show |notes = https://www.cagematch.net//?id=1&nr=9586 |ref = }}{{PWtitlereign |number = 5 |champion = [[The Kartel]]
{{small|([[Sha Samuels]] and Terry Frazier)}} |reign = 1 |date = {{dts|2007|09|23}} |days = {{age in days nts|month1=09|day1=23|year1=2007|month2=09|day2=28|year2=2008}} |location = [[Orpington]], [[Kent]], [[England]] |event = IPW:UK 3rd Anniversary Weekend: Night Two |notes = https://www.cagematch.net//?id=1&nr=13949 |ref = }}{{PWtitlereign |number = 6 |champion = The Thrillers

{{Infobox website | name = Rainway | logo = Rainway_logo.png | logo_size = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = The Rainway logo | screenshot = | collapsetext = <!-- collapsible area's heading (default "Screenshot"); omit/leave blank if collapsible not set --> | background = <!-- for collapsetext heading; default grey (gainsboro) --> | screenshot_size = | screenshot_alt = | caption = | url = {{#statements:P856}} | slogan = | commercial = | type = [[Video game]] [[Streaming media|streaming]] service | registration = Required to use service | language = {{#statements:P407}} | num_users = | content_license = <!-- or: | content_licence = --> | programming_language = | owner = <!-- or: | owners = --> | author = <!-- or: creator / authors / creators --> | editor = <!-- or: | editors = --> | launch_date = {{start date and age|2018|01|20}}<ref name="rainway-delay">{{cite web|title=Ready. Set. Uh, Wait?|url=https://blog.rainway.io/ready-set-uh-wait-4b03aec1c426|website=Rainway Blog|accessdate=16 November 2017|date=13 November 2017}}</ref> | revenue = | alexa = {{WikidataAlexa}} | ip = | issn = <!-- ISSN, e.g. 1085-6706 (automatically linked to http://www.WorldCat.org) --> | oclc = <!-- OCLC number, useful where an ISSN has not been allocated (automatically linked to http://www.WorldCat.org) --> | current_status = | footnotes = }} '''Rainway''' is a [[video game]] [[Streaming media|streaming]] service. Rainway allows users to run games on their [[personal computer|PC]] and play them on other devices over an internet connection. The beta launched on PC on January 20, 2018.<ref name="rainway-delay" /><ref name="digitaltrends" />
== Compatibility == Rainway is compatible with games purchased from [[Steam (software)|Steam]], [[Origin (digital distribution software)|Origin]], [[Battle.net]], Itchio and [[Uplay]]. The service can run in [[web browser]]s and will also be compatible with [[iOS]] and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[smartphone|mobile phones]], as well as [[Xbox One]] consoles. The developers of Rainway also plan to support the service on the [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[PlayStation 4]] (with approval). Rainway's web service can be used through the Nintendo Switch's [[Nintendo_Switch_system_software#System|internal web browser]], which has been used by the Rainway developers for testing the service on the Nintendo Switch, although it is not yet known whether or not [[Nintendo]] will allow the Rainway application to be distributed on the [[Nintendo eShop]].<ref name="digitaltrends">{{Cite web |url=https://www.digitaltrends.com/gaming/rainway-pc-game-streaming-nintendo-switch-support/ |title=Rainway’s PC game streaming service will also support the Nintendo Switch |last=Parrish |first=Kevin |date=2017-06-14 |website=Digital Trends |language=en-US |access-date=2017-11-06}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://bgr.com/2017/08/07/nintendo-switch-pc-game-streaming-half-life-2-rainway/ |title=Watch ‘Half-Life 2’ running on a Nintendo Switch with the Rainway app |last=Siegal |first=Jacob |date=2017-08-08 |website=BGR |language=en-US |access-date=2017-11-06}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nintendolife.com/news/2017/10/rainway_streaming_app_continues_to_push_the_switch_version_teasing_cuphead_footage |title=Rainway Streaming App Continues to Push the Switch Version, Teasing Cuphead Footage |last=Whitehead |first=Thomas |date=2017-10-16 |website=Nintendo Life |language=en-GB |access-date=2017-11-06}}</ref>
== History == Rainway was first announced in March of 2017, by Andrew Sampson, with a beta planned for May 5th. The announcement was made on the official website for Ulterius, another streaming service worked on by Sampson which used similar technologies, but focused on [[Remote desktop software|desktop remote access]] rather than game streaming.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://techraptor.net/content/andrew-sampson-announces-rainway |title=Borderless Gaming Developer Andrew Sampson Announces Rainway |last=Adams |first=Robert |date=2017-03-11 |website=TechRaptor |access-date=9 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Ulterius {{!}} Remote desktop inside any web browser when you need it|url=http://ulterius.io/|website=Ulterius|accessdate=9 November 2017|language=en}}</ref> However, Rainway did not gain significant attention until April, when it announced its plan to support the then-newly released Nintendo Switch console.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://wccftech.com/rainway-pc-game-streaming-switch/ |title=Rainway App Allows 60FPS PC Game Streaming To Nintendo Switch, Xbox One & More |last=Aernout |date=2017-04-24 |website=Wccftech |language=en-US |access-date=2017-11-09}}</ref> During [[E3 2017]], Rainway reiterated that its streaming service would be made available for the Nintendo Switch console, and announced that the Rainway beta would launch on November 25.<ref name="digitaltrends" /> The release of the beta was later delayed again, to January 20.<ref name="rainway-delay" /> == References == {{reflist}}
== External links == *[http://rainway.io Official website]
[[Category:Video gaming]] [[Category:Streaming media systems]] [[Category:Android (operating system) software]]

{{other uses}} {{redirect|Mocking|other uses|Mock (disambiguation){{!}}Mock}} [[File:Colorful Clown 3.jpg|thumb|This ridiculously small hat is incongruous with the man's head size.|200px]]
To be '''ridiculous''' is to be something which is highly incongruous or inferior, sometimes deliberately so to make people laugh or get their attention, and sometimes unintendedly so as to be considered laughable and earn or provoke ridicule and derision. It comes from the 1540s Latin "ridiculosus" meaning "laughable", from "ridiculus" meaning "that which excites laughter", and from "ridere" meaning "to laugh".<ref name=DC>[http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/ridiculous Dictionary.com]</ref> "Ridiculous" is an adjective describing "the ridiculous".
In common usage, "ridiculousness" is used as a synonym for [[absurdity]] or [[nonsense]].<ref>[http://www.thefreedictionary.com/nonsensical Free Dictionary]</ref><ref>[http://thesaurus.com/browse/illogicality Thesaurus.com]</ref> From a historical and technical viewpoint, "absurdity" is associated with argumentation and reasoning, "nonsense" with [[semantics]] and [[Meaning (linguistics)|meaning]], while "ridiculous" is most associated with laughter, superiority, deformity, and incongruity. ''[[Reductio ad absurdum]]'' is a valid method of [[argument]], while ''[[appeal to ridicule|reductio ad ridiculum]]'' is invalid. Argument by [[invective]] declaration of ridiculous is invalid, while arguments involving declarations of nonsense may summarize a [[logical reasoning|cogent]] semantic problem with lack or meaning or [[ambiguity]].
Historically, the ridiculous was central to initial theories of humor and laughter as first put forth by philosopher [[Thomas Hobbes]]. It is currently used in the [[theories of humor|theory of humor]] to create laughter, shock, parody, or satire. Reactions to the ridiculous have been studied in [[psychology]] for its effects on memory, attention, and attitude in social hierarchies. These studies have been applied to the theory of advertisement regarding attention, memory, and alleviation of preexisting negative attitudes toward products. The ridiculous is often contrasted with the [[Sublime (philosophy)|sublime]], one of extreme inferiority, the other of extreme superiority, and often one can suddenly move from one extreme state to the other.
== Humor == {{Further information|Theory of humor}}
=== History: Incongruity, the superiority theory of humor, and deformity === The ridiculous often has extreme incongruity (things that are not thought to belong next to each other) or inferiority, e.g., "when something that was dignified is reduced to a ridiculous position (here noting the element of the incongruous), so that laughter is most intense when we escape from a 'coerced solemnity'."<ref>''Humour, Jokes and the Statement'', Journal of Human Values, 2006, S Acharya, [http://jhv.sagepub.com/content/12/2/179.short]</ref><ref>[http://bjaesthetics.oxfordjournals.org/content/4/3/284 British Journal of Aesthetics, (1964) 4 (3), Harold Osborne, p.284]</ref> For [[Aristotle]], we laugh at inferior or [[unattractiveness|ugly]] individuals, because we feel a joy at being superior to them.<ref>''Poetics'', 1449a, p. 34-35.</ref> [[Socrates]] was reported by [[Plato]] as saying that the ridiculous was characterized by a display of self-ignorance.<ref>Plato, ''Philebus'' 49b ff.</ref> [[Deformity]] was considered by some to be essential to the ridiculous.<ref>Laughter as a Test of Truth in Enlightenment Satire'', Werner von Koppenfels</ref><ref name=HEL>A history of English Laughter: Laughter from Beowulf to Beckett and Beyond, Manfred Pfister</ref> Psychological theories of humor include the "incongruity theory" and the "superiority theory", the latter of which the philosopher Thomas Hobbes was an early proponent.<ref>The Perception of Humor, Willibald Ruch, Emotions, qualia, and consciousness, Biocybernetics, VOl. 10</ref><ref>How Many Feminists Does It Take To Make A Joke? Sexist Humor and What's Wrong With It, Memo Bergmann, Hypatia, Vol.1, Issue 1, March 1986</ref><ref>Humor as a Double‐Edged Sword: Four Functions of Humor in Communication, JC Meyer, Communication Theory, Volume 10, Issue 3, pages 310–331, August 2000</ref> Hobbes claimed that laughter was either caused spontaneously, or by seeing a deformed thing to which one compares themselves and laugh as a form of self applause; "a sudden glory arising from sudden conception of some eminency in ourselves, by comparison of the infirmities of others." <ref name=HEL/> The Right Reverend [[William Warburton]], [[Lord Bishop]] of [[Gloucester]] said in the early 18th century that, "Nothing is ridiculous but what is deformed".<ref>The divine legation of Moses demonstrated, William Warburton</ref> Using the ridiculous is a method in the theory of humor.<ref>Investigating the humor of gelotophobes: Does feeling ridiculous equal being humorless?, Humor - International Journal of Humor Research. Volume 22, Issue 1-2, Pages 111–143, ISSN (Online) 1613-3722, ISSN (Print) 0933-1719, {{doi|10.1515/HUMR.2009.006}}, /February/2009, Willibald Ruch, Ursula Beermann, [http://www.reference-global.com/doi/abs/10.1515/HUMR.2009.006?journalCode=humr]{{dead link|date=February 2017}}</ref>
Although common usage now considers "absurdity" to be synonymous with "ridiculousness", Hobbes discussed the two concepts as different, in that absurdity is viewed as having to do with invalid reasoning, as in [[Hobbes' Table of Absurdity]], while ridiculousness has to do with laughter, superiority, ridicule, and deformity.
=== Native American Ritual Clown === {{Further information|Ritual clown}} The [[Ritual clown]] ([[Heyókȟa]]) in some [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas|Native American]] culture uses the painfully ridiculous, and is believed to become closer to the gods by its [[:wikt:primordial|primordial]]ity.<ref>''Native American Postcolonial Psychology'', E Duran, B Duran</ref><ref>Ambigere: The Euro-American Picaro and the Native American Trickster, Melus, The Society for the Study of the Multi-Ethnic Literature of the United States Vol. 17, No. 1, Spring 1991, F Ballinger</ref> Native American clowns are ridiculous in their contrary and rule breaking antics.<ref>The Mythology of Evil Among North American Indian Yuroks and Its Implications for Western Spirituality, Anthropology of Consciousness, Volume 7, Issue 3, pages 15–29, September 1996, Royal Alsup, Stanley Krippne, [https://www.jstor.org/pss/467321]</ref> In the film ''[[Little Big Man (film)|Little Big Man]]'', the sacred clown rides sitting backwards on his horse, "washes" himself with dirt and "dries" himself with water.<ref>Jennifer L. McMahon, B. Steve Csaki, ''The Philosophy of the Western'' (2010), p. 295.</ref> Heyókȟa are thought of as being incongruously backwards-forwards, upside-down, or contrary in nature. This spirit is often manifest by doing things backwards or unconventionally—riding a horse backwards, wearing clothes inside-out, or speaking backwards. For example, if food were scarce, a Heyókȟa would sit around and complain about how full he was; during a baking hot heat wave a Heyókȟa would shiver with cold and put on gloves and cover himself with a thick blanket. Similarly, when it is 40 degrees below freezing he will wander around naked for hours complaining that it is too hot.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}}
==== Parody and satire in social commentary ==== {{Further information|Parody|Satire}} The ridiculous can use uses both physical and conceptual inferiority and incongruity of juxtaposition to create [[parody]] and [[satire]].
In ''[[Candide]]'', [[Voltaire]] parodies [[Leibniz]]'s argument for the [[existence of evil]] under a benign God using ''"ridiculous rationalizations of evil"''.<ref name="TCD">''"ridiculous rationalizations of evil"''. Teaching Candide-A Debate, The French Review, Vol 61, No. 5, 1988, Theodore E. D. Braun, Felicia Sturzer, Martine Darmon Meyer, [https://www.jstor.org/pss/393842]</ref> Leibniz claimed that God is constrained by logic, and created the best of all ''[[possible worlds]]''. After being reduced from a "[[dignity|dignified]]" state to its opposite, the [[optimistic]] Dr. [[Panglossian|Pangloss]] (representing Leibniz) finds cause to consider his undignified position to be the best of all possible worlds, noting his own particular current happiness, which he argues could not have been attained without experiencing the atrocities in the previous narrative; his optimistic attitude is extremely incongruous with his experiences and extremely inferior undignified ultimate condition.<ref name= TCD/>
In [[Stanley Kubrick]]'s ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey]]'', apelike humans and their behavior are juxtaposed next to streamlined advanced technology with a highly avant garde score by composer [[György Ligeti]]; Ligeti also used ridiculous juxtaposition in his scores to create parody,<ref>Blending the Sublime and the Ridiculous: A Study of Parody in György Ligeti's Le Grand Macabre, Sewell, Amanda J, [https://web.archive.org/web/20110720021116/http://etd.ohiolink.edu/view.cgi?bgsu1150987452]</ref> and this tool was frequently used by composer [[Peter Maxwell Davies]].
=== Deformity and incongruity in performance as social commentary, and lifestyle ===
==== Japanese Butoh dance ==== {{Further information|Butoh}} Japanese [[Butoh]] uses both incongruity and deformity to create ridiculous dance performance and lifestyle; extreme movement methods that are highly incongruous with natural body movement in its dance and everyday lifestyle, as well as in its clothing, actions, costume and set design that is highly incongruous with societal norms, which often shock the audience or visitor, and are sometimes considered not only ridiculous, but incongruently "bizarre and [[beauty|beautiful]]" or "[[elegant]] and [[grotesque]]".<ref>''The Bizarre World of Butoh'', San Fransciso Weekly</ref><ref>''The Bizzare and the Beautiful'', Los Angeles Times, 1989</ref>
==== Theatre of the Ridiculous ==== {{Further information|Theatre of the Ridiculous}} The Theatre of the Ridiculous uses highly incongruous stage settings and incongruous costumes such as [[cross dressing]] to disturb or create shock in the audience.<ref>Conquest of the Ridiculous:Ronald Tavel, John Vaccaro and Charles Ludlam, WarholStars, [http://www.warholstars.org/ridiculous.html]</ref>
== Psychology: attention, memory, and attitudes == Psychologists have studied human response to the ridiculous and its effects on attention and memory.<ref name="ReferenceA">The Psychology of Advertising, Walter Dill Scott, 1910</ref><ref>The Ancient Art of Memory: Usefulness in Treatment, Bernard M. Patten, Archives of Neurology, 1972;26(1):25-31, [http://archneur.ama-assn.org/cgi/content/abstract/26/1/25]</ref>
===Advertising=== The ridiculous is used in advertising to [[Psychological manipulation|manipulate]] attention and attitudes toward products.<ref name="ReferenceA"/><ref>Music for advertising effects, Psychology and Marketing, Volume 1, Issue 3-4, 1984, S Hecker</ref>
== Juxtaposition with the sublime {{anchor| Ridiculous and the sublime}} == The ridiculous is sometimes contrasted to the sublime where something with one quality is thought of as approaching, or likely to change to, the other.
[[Thomas Paine]], writing in ''[[The Age of Reason]]'' in 1795, said ''The sublime and the ridiculous are often so nearly related, that it is difficult to class them separately. One step above the sublime, makes the ridiculous; and one step above the ridiculous, makes the sublime again.''<ref name=odp>{{cite book|chapter=sublime | title=The Oxford Dictionary of Proverbs | editor=Jennifer Speake | publisher=Oxford University Press | year=2009 | url=http://www.oxfordreference.com/views/ENTRY.html?subview=Main&entry=t90.e2157| accessdate=2011-02-13}} ''Available online to subscribers''</ref>
[[Napoleon]], reflecting on the state of his existence following his retreat from Moscow in 1812, famously remarked to Polish ambassador [[Dominique-Georges-Frédéric Dufour de Pradt|D. G. De Pradt]]: ''Du sublime au ridicule il n'y a qu'un pas'' (''There is only one step from the sublime to the ridiculous'').<ref name=DC/><ref name=odp /><ref>The Columbia Dictionary of Quotations, Robert Andrews</ref><ref>British Journal of Aesthetics, Aesthetics (1964) 4 (3), Harold Osborne, p. 284-5, [http://bjaesthetics.oxfordjournals.org/content/4/3/284]</ref>
=== Reduction to the ridiculous, or "reductio ad ridiculum" === {{Further information|Appeal to ridicule|Red herring|straw man}} Reduction to the ridiculous (Latin: "reductio ad ridiculum", also called "Appeal to ridicule", "appeal to mockery", or "the Horse Laugh") is a logical fallacy which presents the opponent's argument in a way that grossly misrepresents it and appears ridiculous next to it, often so misrepresentative as to create a [[straw man]] argument, rather than addressing the argument itself.<ref name=WT>''Wishful Thinking and Other Philosophical Reflections'', Nicholas Rescher, 2009</ref> For example, in arguing against [[idealism]], with its sophisticated arguments that the world was not real but only existed in the [[mind]], philosopher [[Dr. Johnson]] famously kicked a stone.<ref Name=WT/>
Contrasting ridiculousness with absurdity in [[reasoning]], ''Reductio ad ridiculum'' is an invalid method of argument, while ''reductio ad absurdum'' is a valid method.
=== Invective === Arguments are often simply dismissed by calling them "ridiculous" as invective, without further argumentation.<ref name=WT/> Philosopher [[Friedrich Nietzsche]] often dismissed philosophical positions by calling them "ridiculous" without further argument given.<ref name=WT/>
== See also == *[[Camp (style)]] *[[Illogical]] *[[Kitsch]] *[[Non sequitur (logic)]] *[[Stupidity#In comedy|Silly]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
[[Category:English words]] [[Category:Emotions]] [[Category:Humour]] [[Category:Pejorative terms for people]]

revision.comment: Removing link(s) to "Stavros Fasoulas": Article deleted per [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Stavros Fasoulas]]. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{Infobox video game |title = Sanxion |image = [[Image:Sanxion cover.jpg|frameless|Sanxion]] |caption = Cover art (Commodore 64) |developer = [[Thalamus Ltd|Thalamus]] |publisher = [[Thalamus Ltd|Thalamus]] |designer = Stavros Fasoulas |composer = [[Rob Hubbard]] |released = [[1986 in video gaming|October 1986]] (C64)
[[1989 in video gaming|1989]] (Spectrum) |genre = [[Scrolling shooter]] |platforms = [[Commodore 64]], [[ZX Spectrum]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Sanxion''''' is a 1986 [[scrolling shooter]] by [[Thalamus Ltd]], developed by Stavros Fasoulas. It was the first game released by Thalamus. Fasoulas also wrote ''[[Delta (computer game)|Delta]]'' and ''[[Quedex]]''. ==Gameplay== {{no references|section|date=March 2018}} ''Sanxion'' is a horizontally-scrolling shooter. The goal to traverse each level from left to right avoiding or destroying any enemies and obstacles. The side-scroller speed is controllable, increasing the closer the player is to the center of the screen. The screen is divided in two sections, the upper one with an overhead view, and the lower one, taking up two-thirds of the screen, shows a typical side view. Enemies can come from both sides of the screen in close formations that the player must avoid colliding with. While the scrolling is automatic for the most part, the player can control the speed of the engines (there is even a bonus timer that counts down, as an incentive for those who want to "blast through"), and the pitch of the noise alters accordingly, while sounding vaguely like a [[didgeridoo]]. This "adjustable rate autoscroll" is uncommon in the genre ([[Armed Police Unit Gallop]] is another example of this) There are a few exceptions, though. Several levels end with sections where the ship is forced to fly at maximum speed (a two-note siren will sound at the beginning of such sections), where the player must be quick to avoid oncoming barriers. There are two main types of levels in Sanxion, based on the enemies. In some, such as the first, the enemies are constant throughout the level. In some others, such as the second, reaching a certain point (usually change of terrain) will cause all enemies on screen to self-destruct, and a different type of enemy will appear. There are exceptions to these patterns. At the end of each level, there are non-lethal bonus stages which award points to the player for shooting, crashing or avoiding floating letters (the action required depends on the actual letter) at great speed. The background in these stages is rainbow, and the "radar" does not show your ship. ==Music== The [[MOS Technology SID|SID]] music by [[Rob Hubbard]] called "Thalamusik" was played in the [[Commodore 64]] tape loading screen, during several minutes of slow tape load. The piece was inspired by ''[[Zoolook]]'' by [[Jean Michel Jarre]], a piece that Hubbard also reproduced in SID form for some public domain demos.http://www.c64.com/interviews/hubbard_part_2.html It was very popular and later spawned several fan-made remixes.http://www.remix64.com/tune_47500.html The menu plays a [[MOS Technology SID|SID]] version of [[Sergei Prokofiev]]'s ''Dance of the Knights'' piece from the ballet [[Romeo and Juliet (Prokofiev)|Romeo and Juliet]]. ==Ports== ===Sinclair ZX Spectrum=== ''Sanxion'' was ported externally to the [[Sinclair ZX Spectrum]] by Sofstorm Developments in [[1989 in video gaming|1989]] with the subtitle ''the Spectrum Remix'' in both 48k and 128k versions. This port has noticeable gameplay differences, e.g. the scrolling speed is fixed. The music score features renditions of the two main themes composed by Wally Beben. ===Game Boy Advance=== A port was planned by Thalamus Interactive in {{vgy|2001}} for the [[Game Boy Advance]], with updated graphics and new features, like two-player mode and end-of-level bosses. A prototype without split screen was developed, but the game was perceived too financially risky and ultimately canceled "Games that weren't", Retrogamer, Issue 18, p.71 ==Development== ''Sanxion'' was the first Thalamus game to use the ''Cyberload'' loader by John Twiddy, famous for containing the string "hackers fuck off and die".[http://www.c64.com/articles/thalamus_history.html C64.COM - For the best in C64 nostalgia - Thalamus History :Stavros Fasoulas] ''[[Computer Gaming World]]'' noted the presence of the fastloader (although not the string present) and was very thankful for its inclusion.{{Cite news | date = April 1988 | last = Wilson | first = David | periodical = [[Computer Gaming World]] | title = The Best Starfighter: A Comparison of Space Arcade Games | pages = 24–25 | postscript = }} ==Reception== The game was reviewed in 1988 in ''[[Dragon (magazine)|Dragon]]'' #130 by Hartley, Patricia, and Kirk Lesser in "The Role of Computers" column. The reviewers gave the game 4 out of 5 stars.{{cite journal |title=The Role of Computers |last1=Lesser|last2=Lesser|last3=Lesser|first1=Hartley|first2=Patricia|first3=Kirk |journal=Dragon |issue=130 |date=February 1988 |pages=86–91}} ''[[Commodore User]]''''s Mike Pattenden considered the game to be a clone of ''[[Uridium]]'' which was well executed but not really worth purchasing as an alternative to the cheaper rival ''Warhawk''.http://amr.abime.net/issue_2365_reviews It was voted Best Soundtrack of the Year at the [[Golden Joystick Awards]].http://www.worldofspectrum.org/showmag.cgi?mag=C+VG/Issue066/Pages/CVG06600101.jpg In a retrospective review Kristan Reed of ''[[Eurogamer]]'' gave the game a 7/10 rating and said "Although ''Sanxion'' doesn't stand up nearly as well as ''[[Uridium]]'' does these days, it was still a real highlight of the C64's growing love-affair with shooters. If you're a twitch shooter junkie, this is a game you have to play at some stage."http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/sanxion-review ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.zzap64.co.uk/cgi-bin/displaypage.pl?issue=019&page=122&thumbstart=0&magazine=zzap&check=1 ''Zzap!64'' 1986 review] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20051130233116/http://www.c64hq.com/articles/thalamus_history.html Thalamus history at c64hq.com.] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20050314175149/http://www.c64hq.com/interviews/hubbard_part_2.html An interview with Rob Hubbard, Sanxion's musician.] *{{WoS game|id=0004333}} [[Category:1986 video games]] [[Category:Commodore 64 games]] [[Category:Horizontally scrolling shooters]] [[Category:ZX Spectrum games]] [[Category:Europe-exclusive video games]] [[Category:Video games scored by Rob Hubbard]] [[Category:Video games developed in Finland]] [[Category:Thalamus Ltd games]]

{{good article}} {{Use American English|date=April 2014}}{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox video game | title = Secrets of Rætikon | image = File:Secrets of Raetikon title treatment.png | developer = Broken Rules | publisher = Broken Rules | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[OS X]], [[Linux]] | released = April 17, 2014 | genre = [[Action-adventure game|Action-adventure]] | modes = [[Single-player]] }}
'''''Secrets of Rætikon''''' is an [[action-adventure video game|action-adventure]] [[open world]] video game developed and published by Broken Rules. The player controls a bird and must explore the environment of Rætikon to find its secrets. Game elements include animals with specific behaviors and ancient puzzles. Development began in 2011 and the game was formally announced in July 2013 and followed by alpha and Steam Early Access releases. ''Secrets of Rætikon'' was released on April 17, 2014 for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[OS X]], and [[Linux]] platforms. It received mixed reviews from reviewers, who praised its artwork and movement physics, but criticized its inconsistency, lack of cohesion, and technical issues.
== Gameplay ==
{{multiple image |footer=These screenshots of gameplay show the scale of the player-character in the interactive environment. The second image shows the ancient device associated with the game's key objectives. |footer_align=center |width=250 |direction=vertical |image1=Secrets of Raetikon animated screenshot TreeTops.gif |image2=Secrets of Raetikon screenshot shardcreator.png }}
''Secrets of Rætikon'' is a [[single-player]], story-driven, [[open world]] sandbox<ref name="Polygon: release date"/> [[action-adventure video game]].<ref name="Polygon: announce"/> The [[player-character]] takes form of a bird. The player controls the bird with three buttons: one that flaps its wings, another that takes items into the bird's beak, and another that makes bird sounds.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/> While the game can be played through [[keyboard and mouse]], the developers instead recommend a [[video game controller|controller]].<ref name="Joystiq review"/>
The objective is to fly through the Rætikon environment to find its titular secrets, namely by collecting relics to power an ancient device. The environment is split into themed [[Level (video gaming)|levels]] such as swamp, lagoon, mountaintops, and forests. Glowing shards are dispersed throughout each level, which can be collected and redeemed at an altar within each themed level for a glowing relic. These relics can be returned to where the player started the game to power a mysterious, ancient device. The player-character carries the relics past aggressive enemies and treacherous environment, and completes [[puzzle video game|puzzles]] of reconstructing animal statues from its pieces to access new levels.<ref name="Joystiq review"/> Each level features different animals and contain environmental objects that player can interact with.<ref name="Polygon: release date"/>
== Development == ''Rætikon'' was first announced in July 2013,<ref name="Polygon: announce"/> though its development began in 2011.<ref name="Polygon: Indiegogo"/> The game's [[Vienna|Viennese]] developer and publisher, Broken Rules Games, had previously worked on the 2012 [[Wii U]] game ''Chasing Aurora'',<ref name="Polygon: announce"/> which itself was based on a multiplayer prototype for ''Rætikon''.<ref name="Gamasutra: Chasing Aurora"/> The game is partly based on an [[Alps]] region culture conquered by the [[Roman Empire]].<ref name="Polygon: release date"/> Its visuals were inspired by dream-like flying sensations.<ref name="Polygon: announce"/> In an effort to increase the game's [[replay value]], the developers emphasized its [[Artificial intelligence (video games)|artificial intelligence]], physics, and interactive qualities, including animal-specific behaviors and strippable plant foliage.
Broken Rules released an [[alpha version]] of the game in October 2013. Around the same time, they announced an [[Indiegogo]] [[crowdfunding]] campaign in lieu of searching for a [[video game publisher|publisher]].<ref name="Polygon: Indiegogo"/> The game later entered [[Steam Early Access]].<ref name="Polygon: release date"/> ''Rætikon'' was released on April 17, 2014 for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[OS X]], and [[Linux]] platforms via [[Steam (software)|Steam]], the [[Mac App Store]], and the [[Humble Store]]. The Steam edition of the game supports [[Steam Workshop]] with a level editor for users to build and share original content.<ref name="Polygon: release date"/>
== Reception ==
{{Video game reviews | MC = 58/100<ref name=Metacritic/> | EuroG = 6/10<ref name="Eurogamer review"/> | Joystiq = {{rating|2.5|5}}<ref name="Joystiq review"/> | rev1 = ''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' | rev1Score = 2/5<ref name="HG review"/> }}
The game received "mixed or average reviews", according to video game review score aggregator [[Metacritic]].<ref name=Metacritic/> Reviewers praised the game's artwork and movement physics, but criticized its lack of cohesion.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/><ref name="HG review"/> Some appreciated the moments where the game's elements coalesced.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/><ref name="Joystiq review"/> They estimated the game to run between two<ref name="Joystiq review"/> and three hours in length.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/>
''Joystiq''{{'s}} Sam Prell said that the adventure felt restrictive and linear, "like a guided tour".<ref name="Joystiq review"/> He wrote that ''Rætikon''{{'s}} map design encourages players to think methodically about their path rather than to explore the game as a non-linear open world. In this way, he felt that its gameplay philosophies contradicted.<ref name="Joystiq review"/> ''Hardcore Gamer''{{'s}} Geoff Thew wrote that the game "commits a number of fundamental design sins" as one of "few games so ceaselessly tiring to play".<ref name="HG review"/> He felt that the animals who steal the game objectives created "busywork", and complained of copious backtracking and the "straight up discourteous" exclusion of an in-game map.<ref name="HG review"/> ''Eurogamer''{{'s}} Jon Denton added that numerous "extremely irritating conflicts" with off-screen animals hurt the game's pacing.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/> He noted its gameplay influence from ''[[Fez (video game)|Fez]]'' and compared its blue shards game mechanics to that of ''[[Dark Souls]]''.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/> Denton did not feel that the game deserved the amount of effort it required of its players to understand its story.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/> Reviewers noted technical issues and glitches within the game. Prell noted issues in the game's physics and [[game save]] features. As ''Rætikon'' does not support manual saves, he frequently found his progress automatically saved while his player-character was stuck in the environment.<ref name="Joystiq review"/> Thew of ''Hardcore Gamer'' found similar physics glitches that trapped him in the environment, which led him to use his keyboard alongside the Xbox 360 controller to circumvent controller compatibility issues.<ref name="HG review"/>
When mentioning the game's art style, most reviewers gave positive response. Denton described the style as a "beautifully drawn, angular 2D world".<ref name="Eurogamer review"/> Prell wrote that ''Rætikon''{{'s}} triangle-based art style made its characters feel like [[papercraft]] and gave the game "a sense of reverence and spirituality" when complemented by the story, and gave comparison to ''[[Shadow of the Colossus]]''.<ref name="Joystiq review"/> Thew gave similar response noting that it is reminiscent of Origami. However, Thew continued to state that while the visuals were "distinctive", the game's "alpine" area was "clichéd and predictable" and its "good looks and smooth movement mechanics" did not compensate for the rest of the game's design.<ref name="HG review"/> He found the game "shallow", uninteresting, and "a disappointment ... on almost every level".<ref name="HG review"/> Denton of ''Eurogamer'' praised the moments where he figured out how to find a shard or alphabet piece, but ultimately found ''Rætikon'' "awkward", with "substance did not live up to its style", and causing unjustified and unreasonable frustration.<ref name="Eurogamer review"/>

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = '''Sefi Rivlin'''
{{Hebrew|ספי ריבלין}} | image = חיתוך תמונה ספי ריבלין.jpg | imagesize = 150px | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1947|11|07}} | birth_place = [[Rishon LeZion|Nahalat Yehuda]], [[Mandatory Palestine]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2013|12|3|1947|11|07}} | death_place = [[Ramat Gan]], [[Israel]] | restingplace = | restingplacecoordinates = | othername = | occupation = [[Actor]], [[Comedian]] | yearsactive = | spouse = Rina (4 children) | partner = | children = }} '''Sefi Rivlin''' ({{lang-he-n|ספי ריבלין}}; born November 7, 1947 – December 3, 2013) was an [[Israel]]i actor and comedian. He was best known for his roles in "Nikui Rosh" [Clear Your Head], a satire program, and the children’s programs "[[Rega im Dodley]]" (A Moment with Dodley) and "[[BaBayit shel Fistuk]]" (Fistuk's House).[http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Israeli-actor-and-comedian-Sefi-Rivlin-passes-away-at-age-66-333891 Israeli actor and comedian Sefi Rivlin passes away at age 66] ==Biography== Yosef (Sefi) Rivlin born and grew up in Nahalat Yehuda (present-day [[Rishon LeZion]]). He born to the [[Rivlin]] family. He studied acting at the [[Beit Zvi]] School for the Performing Arts. He was married to Rina, with whom he had four children. Rivlin was diagnosed with throat cancer in 2007. In 2010, he announced that he was cured, but in 2012, he underwent further treatment that left him unable to speak. He died in [[Sheba Medical Center]] in [[Ramat Gan]] at the age of 66 although rumors of his death began to circulate earlier, after the death of Israeli singer [[Arik Einstein]].[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.561595 Veteran Israeli comedian Sefi Rivlin dies at 66, [[Haaretz]]] A memorial ceremony held at [[Habimah Theater]] in [[Tel Aviv]] on the morning of the funeral was attended by a large crowd of Israeli entertainers and politicians. Rivlin was buried in the old cemetery of Rishon LeZion.[http://www.haaretz.com/culture/arts-leisure/.premium-1.561872 Comedian, actor Sefi Rivlin laid to rest after star-studded funeral, [[Haaretz]]] ==Acting career== Rivlin's acting debut was in 1973, when he appeared at the [[Khan Theater]] in [[Jerusalem]] in [[Servant of Two Masters]], directed by the British-born director Mike Alfreds.[http://www.jpost.com/Arts-and-Culture/Arts/Rivlins-last-laugh-334001 Rivlin's last laugh] He played the part of the [[Archie Bunker]] character on ''Itche'' - the Israeli version of ''[[All in the Family]]'' - and starred in the series Sefi, an Israeli version of Britain's [[Mr. Bean]]. He acted in musicals and often served as master of ceremonies at children’s festivals. Rivlin appeared on the long-running comedy show [[Zehu Ze!]]. In the 1980s and 1990s, he appeared in a number of films, including director [[Avi Nesher]]'s [[The Secrets (film)|HaSodot]].[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4461069,00.html Actor, comedian Seffy Rivlin dies at 66 ] ==Sports career== {{Infobox football biography | name = Sefi Rivlin | image = | fullname = Yosef (Sefi) Rivlin | birth_date = | birth_place = | height = | currentclub = | clubnumber = | position = | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Hapoel Rishon LeZion F.C.]] | years1 = 1962–1969 | clubs1 = [[Hapoel Rishon LeZion F.C.]] | caps1 = | goals1 = | pcupdate = }} He enrolled in the youth football club of [[Hapoel Rishon LeZion F.C.]] and later on played in the senior side from 1962 until 1969.http://www.local.co.il/rishonlezion/110830/article.htm ==Political activism== A supporter of the [[Likud]] party, he appeared in advertisements for the party in the 1984 national elections. He briefly served on the Rishon LeZion City Council. In 2008, he ran in the [[primaries]] to determine the Likud list for the [[Eighteenth Knesset]], but was placed in an unrealistic place on the list. ==Awards and recognition== Rivlin won the Israeli Television Academy award. In 2002, he won the Golden Mask prize for lifetime achievement. A Jerusalem Post columnist who interviewed him said: "Watching him is very simply an audience with a comic artist - hour after hour, he creates comedy. In person, he is much funnier than he is on TV. Face to face, his bug eyes and mugging and comic airs, and, above all, his nonstop improvisatory ability, are explosively funny."[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-17011419.html No Funny Business, [[Jerusalem Post]]] Upon the news of his death Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] called Rivlin a “friend and companion” and a "beloved artist who made generations of Israelis laugh with his witty humor.”[http://www.timesofisrael.com/israeli-comedian-sefi-rivlin-dies-at-age-66/ Israeli comedian Sefi Rivlin dies at age 66] ==See also== *[[Television in Israel]] *[[Culture of Israel]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|0729707}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rivlin, Sefi}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from cancer]] [[Category:Jewish Israeli male actors]] [[Category:Israeli television personalities]] [[Category:Israeli comedians]] [[Category:Israeli entertainers]] [[Category:Israeli footballers]] [[Category:Jewish footballers]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Football players from Rishon LeZion]] [[Category:People from Rishon LeZion]] [[Category:Hapoel Rishon LeZion F.C. players]] [[Category:Association footballers not categorized by position]]

{{Infobox company |name=Smackgirl |logo=[[File:SMKGRLOGO.gif|250px|Smackgirl Logo]] |type=Private |genre= |fate=Transformed into [[Jewels (mixed martial arts)|Jewels]] |predecessor=ReMix |successor=[[Jewels (mixed martial arts)|Jewels]] |foundation= {{Start date|2001|05}} |founder= |defunct={{End date|2008|10}} |location=[[Japan]] |area_served=Japan |key_people=Motoki Shino (president)
[[Koichiro Kimura]] (founder) |industry=[[Mixed martial arts]] promotion |services= |parent=Kilgore |homepage=[https://web.archive.org/web/*/http://www.smackgirl.com/ (Internet archive)] }} '''Smackgirl''' was a Japanese mixed martial arts promotion focused solely on [[Women's mixed martial arts|female fighters]]. The promotion also held grappling and amateur events along with its main line of professional MMA cards. After financial difficulties throughout 2008 the promotion was sold to Marverous Japan Co.,Ltd. and [[Rebranding|rebranded]] [[Jewels (mixed martial arts)|JEWELS]].{{cite web | url = http://www.sherdog.com/news/articles/Jewels-Gets-Debut-Hioki-Sato-Set-for-Shooto-14970 | title = Jewels Gets Debut; Hioki-Sato Set for Shooto | author = Breen, Jordan | date = 2008-10-30 | work = | publisher = Sherdog | location = USA | accessdate = 2010-08-22 }} Unlike conventional MMA in Japan, Smackgirl did not allow striking to the head while in a grounded position. There was also a 30-second limit for ground fighting but it was abolished by 2008.{{cite web | url = http://frankp316.blogspot.com/2008/04/ward-tavares-marquez-arrive-in-tokyo.html | title = Ward, Tavares, Marquez arrive in Tokyo for Smackgirl show | author = Pozen, Frank | date = 2008-04-24 | work = | publisher = Frank Pozen's Big Bad Blog | location = USA | accessdate = 2010-08-29 | quote = He believes that Smackgirl's abolition of the 30 second ground rule will help Marquez because she has strong training in jiu jitsu & submission wrestling. }} There were four weight classes: flyweight (under 48 kg), lightweight (under 52 kg), middleweight (under 58 kg), and openweight (no limit).{{cite web | url = http://www.smackgirl.com/rules_SGSofficial_english.pdf | title = Smackgirl strike official rules and regulations | author = | date = 2007-03-01 | work = | publisher = Smackgirl | location = Japan | format = PDF | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070927090720/http://www.smackgirl.com/rules_SGSofficial_english.pdf | archivedate = 2007-09-27 | accessdate = 2010-08-29 }} Before being Smackgirl, the ReMix banner was used and held its first event in {{Start date|2000|12|05}}. After another event with the ReMix brand, the promotion morphed into Smackgirl in {{Start date|2001|05}}.{{cite web | url = http://www.sherdog.com/news/news/Smackgirl-Postponed-Financial-Problems-Possible-13616 | title = Smackgirl Postponed, Financial Problems Possible | author = Breen, Jordan |author2=Loiseleur, Tony | date = 2008-07-10 | work = | publisher = Sherdog | location = USA | accessdate = 2010-08-22 }} ==Rules== ===Weight classes=== *[[Flyweight (MMA)|Flyweight]] (-''{{convert|48|kg|lb st|1|abbr=on}}'') *[[Lightweight (MMA)|Lightweight]] (-''{{convert|53|kg|lb st|1|abbr=on}}'') *[[Middleweight (MMA)|Middleweight]] (-''{{convert|58|kg|lb st|1|abbr=on}}'') *Open weight ==Former champions== ===Open division=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: small; width: 100%;" |- !
